sn55.33:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurture happiness.
sn55.33:1.3: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.33:3.1: Furthermore, a noble disciple is wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
sn55.33:3.2: This is the fourth kind of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurtures happiness.
sn55.33:3.3: These are the four kinds of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurture happiness.”
